docs.snippet: Europe knows that democracies can collapse. It watches Trump with memories of when the sky darkened.
A witness to Friday’s shooting at a mall in Munich streamed on Facebook what he saw from his balcony. Thousands watched the grisly events unfold in real time.
Tech companies like Sprint, Comcast and Facebook are increasingly working to make high-speed internet available to every American.

headline.print_headline: Tech Companies Expect Free High-Speed Internet Now to Pay Off Later
headline.main: Tech Companies Expect Free High-Speed Internet for Poorer Americans to Pay Off Later

docs.abstract: Telecom and tech firms, including Sprint, Comcast and Facebook, are attempting to bring free or cheap high-speed internet service to low-income and rural populations; their intentions are both motivated by philanthropy and hopes of gaining new full-paying American customers in future.

docs.snippet: CenturyLink’s purchase of Level 3 is the latest sign of action in the high-potential, high-cost and high-stakes business of networking.

headline.main: Daily Report: A $25 Billion Fiber Merger

docs.snippet: Ms. Sandberg, chief operating officer of Facebook, and a collaborator will focus on hardship and resilience.

headline.print_headline: Sandberg’s Grief Inspires a Book About Resilience
headline.main: Her Husband’s Death Motivates Sheryl Sandberg to Write Another Book

docs.abstract: Facebook chief operating officer Sheryl Sandberg is writing book about resilience, co-authored by Adam Grant and tentatively titled Option B; Sandberg’s husband David Goldberg died suddenly in 2015.

docs.snippet: You may know her from “Orange Is the New Black,” but Ashley August is also a celebrated spoken word artist. Ms. August performed her poem “The Game” for The Times’s 30 Under 30 on Facebook Live.

headline.main: Ashley August on Race and Violence

docs.snippet: How a strange new class of media outlet has arisen to take over our news feeds.

headline.main: Inside Facebook’s (Totally Insane, Unintentionally Gigantic, Hyperpartisan) Political-Media Machine

docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump needed to drown out his embarrassing “Access Hollywood” video from 2005. So he tried to bring back 1998, and the Monica Lewinsky scandal.

headline.print_headline: A Debate? Or Rivals Just Trying to Go Viral?
headline.main: Was That a Debate? Or Were the Candidates Just Trying to Go Viral?

docs.abstract: James Poniewozik Critic's Notebook holds second debate between Donald J Trump and Hillary Clinton hit unprecedented low; Trump, in effort to negate 2005 bombshell tape of his lewd comments about women, resurrects 1998 Monica Lewinsky scandal, replete with seating of three women who had previously accused Bill Clinton of sexual abuse in audience.

docs.snippet: The Facebook co-founder and his wife announced an effort to prevent, cure or at least manage all diseases by the end of this century.

headline.print_headline: Not Thinking Small for $3 Billion Investment
headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan Pledge $3 Billion to Fighting Disease

docs.abstract: Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Dr Priscilla Chan's company Chan Zuckerberg Initiative will invest at least $3 billion over next decade toward preventing, curing or managing all diseases by end of century.

docs.snippet: It’s easier than ever to plan, troubleshoot and make the most of your trip, with niche-focused apps as well as the old-guard networks.

headline.print_headline: 5 ways social media can help you travel
headline.main: 5 ways social media can help you travel
